text: Welcome to ICVS!

text: We’re excited to have you join our community of researchers, students, and professionals committed to advancing life and health sciences. Joining a new institute can feel overwhelming at first — new faces, new spaces, new systems — but we’re here to help you get settled in and feel at home.

text: Together, we strive to conduct research of excellence, support scientific careers, and contribute meaningfully to health innovation in Portugal and beyond. We count on your ideas, your energy, and your collaboration.

text: ICVS, who we are
clean_text: icvs who we are

text: The Life and Health Sciences Research Institute (ICVS) was established in 2003 to develop biomedical research within the School of Medicine of the University of Minho.
clean_text: the life and health sciences research institute icvs was established in to develop biomedical research within the school of medicine of the university of minho

text: Currently, the ICVS is a multidisciplinary unit that brings together scientists, engineers and clinicians in a unique scientific and technological environment encased within over 6000 m2, benefiting from research expertise in different fields such as bioimaging, cell and molecular biology, deep learning and computer science, electrophysiology, epidemiology and statistics, structural and functional MRI analysis, medical electronics, microbiology with ABSL2/3 facilities, regenerative medicine, motor and cognitive animal behavior, oncobiology and surgical endoscopy. Our knowledge encompasses the complete R&D pipeline: from in vitro research to animal models, drug discovery and pre-clinical validation, to clinical trials, and finally to reach the market as innovative medical solutions.

text: Over the last decade, the ICVS has developed synergies with several partners with complementary expertise, namely the 3B’s Research Group ensuing the establishment of the PT Government ICVS/3B’s- Associate Laboratory, local healthcare providers and the Clinical Academic Centre – Braga Association (2CA-Braga), devoted to performing clinical research. The ICVS is also integrated several national research infrastructures, among which PT-OPEN and EATRIS.PT, for drug discovery and development.

text: The ICVS develops projects in national and international consortia, providing experience and training to young researchers, welcomes foreign students and researchers, and launches initiatives to foster international institutional collaborations, such as those established with the International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory (INL), the Centro de Investigacións Biomédicas (CINBIO) and the Radboud University.

text: Along with its several Spin-offs, the ICVS aims to contribute as a key stakeholder for the upholding of a competitive Cluster in Biomedical Science, Technology and Healthcare, steered by the School of Medicine, including the 2CA-Braga, the Digital Medicine center P5, and the knowledge transfer structure B.ACIS. Aligned with this vision, the ICVS aspires to boost its complete research pipeline to create scientific knowledge and value, producing Research Outputs that improve Clinical Outcomes.

text: In ICVS, all wet laboratory space is housed together in expansive shared open space, rather than each team having its own separate rooms. text: Behind every research project is a support structure that keeps things running smoothly. In this sense, researchers can rely on the services provided by the Administrative Unit of the ICVS (UA-ICVS), which include administrative procedures and technical advice, in direct interaction with UMinho central services. text: All new members must read and sign the Confidentiality Agreement. text: Research integrity is a cornerstone of scientific excellence and social trust. At ICVS, we align our practices with the Code of Ethical Conduct of the University of Minho, the European Code of Conduct for Research Integrity (ALLEA), and frameworks such as ones promoted by the University of Minho on Harassment and Discrimination and the UNESCO Recommendation on Science and Scientific Researchers. This guide aims to orient students to uphold these principles throughout their academic journey.
clean_text: research integrity is a cornerstone of scientific excellence and social trust at icvs we align our practices with the code of ethical conduct of the university of minho the european code of conduct for research integrity allea and frameworks such as ones promoted by the university of minho on harassment and discrimination and the unesco recommendation on science and scientific researchers this guide aims to orient students to uphold these principles throughout their academic journey

text: Research integrity at ICVS is grounded in a commitment to the following core principles:
clean_text: research integrity at icvs is grounded in a commitment to the following core principles

text: Honesty: being truthful at every stage of the research process, from data collection to the communication of results.
clean_text: honesty being truthful at every stage of the research process from data collection to the communication of results

text: Accountability: taking full responsibility for the research process, from conception to publication.
clean_text: accountability taking full responsibility for the research process from conception to publication

text: Rigor: applying the highest standards in the design, execution, analysis, and reporting of research.
clean_text: rigor applying the highest standards in the design execution analysis and reporting of research

text: Transparency: clearly disclosing methods, data sources, and any conflicts of interest.
clean_text: transparency clearly disclosing methods data sources and any conflicts of interest

text: Fairness: ensuring equitable recognition in collaboration, authorship, and peer review.
clean_text: fairness ensuring equitable recognition in collaboration authorship and peer review

text: Respect: upholding the dignity, welfare, and rights of all involved in research, including humans, animals, and ecosystems.
clean_text: respect upholding the dignity welfare and rights of all involved in research including humans animals and ecosystems

text: These principles form the foundation of responsible science and are expected of all ICVS researchers, regardless of their career stage.
clean_text: these principles form the foundation of responsible science and are expected of all icvs researchers regardless of their career stage

section: Institutional and Legal Frameworks for Research Ethics and Integrity
text: Code of Ethical Conduct of the University of Minho: Sets out the core ethical principles and standards expected from all members of the University of Minho academic community. It addresses areas such as professional integrity, conflicts of interest, and responsible behaviour in academic and institutional settings. The Code also outlines preventive measures against corruption and defines mechanisms for accountability and sanctions in cases of misconduct.

section: Institutional and Legal Frameworks for Research Ethics and Integrity
text: Ethics Council of the University of Minho: Advises on ethical matters and promotes reflection on ethical issues pertinent to the University of Minho academic and research community.
clean_text: ethics council of the university of minho advises on ethical matters and promotes reflection on ethical issues pertinent to the university of minho academic and research community

section: Institutional and Legal Frameworks for Research Ethics and Integrity
text: Ethics Committees of the University of Minho: Committees with specific responsibility for providing informed assessments on the procedural and ethical compliance of research and development (R&D) activities. These include scientific, technological, or experimental projects conducted across the various disciplinary fields and within the academic and research units of the University of Minho.
clean_text: ethics committees of the university of minho committees with specific responsibility for providing informed assessments on the procedural and ethical compliance of research and development rd activities these include scientific technological or experimental projects conducted across the various disciplinary fields and within the academic and research units of the university of minho

text: National Ethics Committee for Clinical Research (CEIC): An independent public ethics body operating under the Ministry of Health. While not a regulatory authority itself, its legally binding ethical opinions are required for the authorization of clinical trials and certain biomedical studies in Portugal. It plays a central role in the national framework for ethical oversight of human research. It issues the single ethical opinion required for clinical trials, evaluates study protocols in terms of risk-benefit, consent, investigator qualifications, and participant safety, and coordinates the national ethics committee network. CEIC also promotes ethical literacy, public trust in clinical research, and alignment with international standards.
clean_text: national ethics committee for clinical research ceic an independent public ethics body operating under the ministry of health while not a regulatory authority itself its legally binding ethical opinions are required for the authorization of clinical trials and certain biomedical studies in portugal it plays a central role in the national framework for ethical oversight of human research it issues the single ethical opinion required for clinical trials evaluates study protocols in terms of riskbenefit consent investigator qualifications and participant safety and coordinates the national ethics committee network ceic also promotes ethical literacy public trust in clinical research and alignment with international standards

text: National Council of Ethics for the Life Sciences (CNECV): An independent advisory body reporting to the Portuguese Parliament. It issues ethical opinions and recommendations on matters related to life sciences, biomedical research, emerging technologies, and health policies. The CNECV plays a key role in promoting national dialogue and reflection on complex ethical issues in science and healthcare.
clean_text: national council of ethics for the life sciences cnecv an independent advisory body reporting to the portuguese parliament it issues ethical opinions and recommendations on matters related to life sciences biomedical research emerging technologies and health policies the cnecv plays a key role in promoting national dialogue and reflection on complex ethical issues in science and healthcare

text: Decreto-Lei n.º 113/2013: Establishes the rules governing the protection of animals used for scientific purposes in Portugal, in line with EU Directive 2010/63/EU. It regulates the ethical review, authorization, housing, care, and use of animals in research, as well as training requirements and institutional responsibilities.

text: Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion

text: The University of Minho is committed to fostering an inclusive academic environment that promotes Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI), where diversity is valued, and all individuals can reach their full potential without fear of prejudice, discrimination, or harassment. This commitment is grounded in the university's Statutes and its Code of Ethical Conduct, and the university's Gender Equality Plan (IGUM) which emphasizes justice, equity, and equal opportunities for all members of the academic community.

text: A key component of IGUM is the Prevention of Gender-Based Harassment and Discrimination, which seeks to eradicate such behaviors through primary, secondary, and tertiary prevention strategies.
